original_solution_mapping.L1: Before the extra colored pencils, he had 150/5=<<150/5=30>>30 colored pencils in each container.
original_solution_mapping.L2: With the other colored pencils, he is given he now has 150+30=<<150+30=180>>180 colored pencils
original_solution_mapping.L3: If you distribute them evenly each container should have 180/5=<<180/5=36>>36 colored pencils

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7079.
    Returns: the number of colored pencils each container can hold after redistribution.
    """
    # L1
    initial_pencils = 150 # 150 colored pencils
    num_containers = 5 # 5 containers
    pencils_per_container_initial = initial_pencils / num_containers

    # L2
    added_pencils = 30 # 30 more pencils
    total_pencils = initial_pencils + added_pencils

    # L3
    pencils_per_container_final = total_pencils / num_containers

    # FA
    answer = pencils_per_container_final
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Before the extra colored pencils, he had {initial_pencils}/{num_containers}=<<{initial_pencils}/{num_containers}={pencils_per_container_initial}>>{pencils_per_container_initial} colored pencils in each container.
With the other colored pencils, he is given he now has {initial_pencils}+{added_pencils}=<<{initial_pencils}+{added_pencils}={total_pencils}>>{total_pencils} colored pencils

If you distribute them evenly each container should have {total_pencils}/{num_containers}=<<{total_pencils}/{num_containers}={pencils_per_container_final}>>{pencils_per_container_final} colored pencils
